Description: Body sherd of Corinthian pottery globular aryballos; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of quatrefoil motif; around base, series of short strokes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Payne (1931), p. 320, fig. 161.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 38, pl. XXIII, no. 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.302) (phase 3)
